data.title: Carl Sagan – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about Carl Sagan. Browse Carl Sagan’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
Cosmos

A Personal Voyage

By: Carl Sagan

Narrated by: LeVar Burton, Seth MacFarlane, Neil deGrasse Tyson, and others

Length: 14 hrs and 31 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 9,363

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 8,381

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 8,342

Cosmos is one of the bestselling science books of all time. In clear-eyed prose, Sagan reveals a jewel-like blue world inhabited by a life form that is just beginning to discover its own identity and to venture into the vast ocean of space....

3 out of 5 stars

Over-acting voice actors

By Seph on 11-09-17

The Demon-Haunted World

Science as a Candle in the Dark

By: Carl Sagan

Narrated by: Cary Elwes, Seth MacFarlane

Length: 17 hrs and 23 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 5,269

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 4,628

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 4,597

How can we make intelligent decisions about our increasingly technology-driven lives if we don’t understand the difference between the myths of pseudoscience and the testable hypotheses of science? Find out....

3 out of 5 stars

Some good points, but not a great book

By William Jenks on 07-25-19

By RoguePisigit on 12-07-19

A Rare Recording of Astrophysicist Carl Sagan Discussing Planet Earth

By: Carl Sagan

Narrated by: Carl Sagan

Length: 59 mins

Original Recording

Overall

0 out of 5 stars 0

Performance

0 out of 5 stars 0

Story

0 out of 5 stars 0

Carl Edward Sagan, born in Brooklyn, NY, was an American astronomer and astrophysicist. The following is a lecture Sagan gave in 1977 during which he discussed the place, scale and geometry of earth–the third planet from the Sun, formed 4.5 billion years ago–in our solar system.
